au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig
Class AbstractControlledRig

java.lang.Object
  au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.AbstractRig
      au.edu.uts.eng.remotelabs.rigclient.rig.AbstractControlledRig
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRig, IRigControl, IRigExerciser, IRigSession
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConfiguredControlledRig, TestConfiguredControlledRig
public abstract class AbstractControlledRig
extends AbstractRig
implements IRigControl

Abstract rig type class for rigs which provide direct control of the rig using the rig client.

performBatch

public boolean performBatch(java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.lang.String userName)
Description copied from interface: IRigControl
Starts a batch control invocation with the provided file reference. Prior to calling this, the isBatchRunning method should be called to ensure no previous batch control is still in execution. If so, this method fails. Also note, results of a prior batch control invocation will be cleared upon the calling of this method, provided the batch invocation is complete.

Specified by:
performBatch in interface IRigControl
Parameters:
fileName - file name of instruction
userName - user who requested batch control
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

isBatchRunning

public boolean isBatchRunning()
Description copied from interface: IRigControl
Specifies if a batch control invocation is in progress.

Specified by:
isBatchRunning in interface IRigControl
Returns:
true if batch running

abortBatch

public boolean abortBatch()
Description copied from interface: IRigControl
Aborts a batch control invocation. The response is true if no batch control invocation is running.

Specified by:
abortBatch in interface IRigControl
Returns:
true if no invocation is running

getBatchProgress

public int getBatchProgress()
Description copied from interface: IRigControl
Gets the progress of the current batch control invocation. The result may be: - 1 .. 99 - Percentage complete - 0 - None started - 100 - Complete - -1 - Rig type doesn't support getting progress

Specified by:
getBatchProgress in interface IRigControl
Returns:
progress indication or -1 if not supported

getBatchResults

public IRigControl.BatchResults getBatchResults()
Description copied from interface: IRigControl
Gets the batch results for either the in-progress or finished batch control invocation. If no invocations have been started null is returned.

Specified by:
getBatchResults in interface IRigControl
Returns:
batch results for in-progress or finished invocation

Returns:
